That is fair enough. 

I mean the kids thing to me at least is a bit irrelevant now cause his kids are teenagers now which is generally a lot less maintenance than smaller children so I doubt that things would really affect her too much on that end. And they both seem to love their Aunt Robin. 

I felt it did make sense for Robin to get lonely (definitely donâ€™t agree with them making her look that old but they did the same to Ted so I canâ€™t really complain) but sheâ€™s always been one to push people away despite really needing them as weâ€™ve seen through out the show. She has been independent and successful but no one wants to be alone. I think itâ€™s natural that after accomplishing your dreams you start to wonder about family and all those other things. 

I just think the story is about the different types of love and relationships that people end up being in through out their lives. One was Robin and One was Tracy. Iâ€™m not saying theyâ€™d be together till they died but it definitely made sense that they would both want to see how things would go between them now that all that other stuff wasnâ€™t in the way. 

The Alternate ending wraps things up in a neat, nostalgic bow but I personally liked the more â€œwhat does this meanâ€ angle, cause I like a cliffhanger and the possibilities.

I donâ€™t think he was waiting for the chance. I do believe the greatest love of his live was Tracy. The way he talks about her, the crazy similarities (like the driving gloves). But she died! I donâ€™t think he would have ever thought about Robin that way again if Tracy was still in the picture, at least from what we were shown he never does that. 

Plus in one of the scenes that didnâ€™t make it into the final episode, Robin comes on to Ted and he rejects her. Something 30 year old Ted would have never been able to do. Ted clearly loved Tracy, I just think 6 years is definitely an acceptable time to mourn your wife and consider dating an old flame. And I think itâ€™s pretty natural when youâ€™re telling your kids youâ€™re entire life story to realise things you probably hadnâ€™t. 

Hindsight goes a long way, but I donâ€™t think heâ€™s completely fallen back in love with her, I think it was more a matter of realising how much emotion he had for her, the only woman apart from Tracy (the actual love of his life) that he truly truly loved and that something could come from this. 

Granted those scenes were cut for time, but if you havenâ€™t watched those then definitely do cause I think they give a better rounded view of the series and make things come into view a bit https://youtu.be/WS0xaSTvPQw 

Still I know thatâ€™s just my opinion cause Iâ€™ve never hated the finale as much as most people did I guess.

Yeah I think questioning voices is the best way really. I started therapy this year for the first time and that piece of advice really helped!! Sadly Iâ€™ve had to stop cause of the virus but Iâ€™m trying to keep the skills.

Thank you for the encouragement! I do recognise Iâ€™m not in Bojackâ€™s boat at all cause Iâ€™ve acknowledged my issues early on and Iâ€™m trying to do better and make smarter choices and love myself more so that definitely a massive step in the right direction.

Honestly that really petrified me cause Iâ€™m only 18 and Iâ€™ve been dealing with those voices for the past 4 years and the thought I could be Bojackâ€™s age and still have them full on sent me in to panic mode. Had to stop watching for a few days.

I donâ€™t think it was that they werenâ€™t compatible in the long run. I think it was that they met at the wrong time. Robin was career focused and didnâ€™t want kids and Ted was all about the white picket fence. At the end Robin had had her fabulous career and done all she wanted and so did Ted. They always had such strong feeling for each other and 6 years is a longgg time before you get with an ex again. Idk I guess Iâ€™ve never been that angry at the ending. Just wish we got to see Tracy more.

As much as I love Times Arrow, Old Sugarmanâ€™s Place and The view from Halfway down have my heart. 

Old Sugarmanâ€â€™s place perfectly introduces us to the start of the inter generational trauma and it definitely allows us to humanise Beatrice a lot more. Itâ€™s a heartbreaking story also beautiful animated with how they use the flashbacks. Honestly stunning. 

The view from halfway down canâ€™t have enough praise in adding to the existential dread of life and the finality of death. 

Times arrow is a lovely episode too donâ€™t get me wrong. Giving us a much better look at Beatrice and Bojackâ€™s relationship and Hollyhocks mothers scribbled face still leaves me in awe. Itâ€™s a great episode. But without Old Sugarmanâ€™s Place it wouldnâ€™t be as strong as it was.
